front.title: IANA Registration of the SFUACFG Application Service Tag

abstract.t: This document defines an application service tag for use according to RFC 4848 in the automated SIP User Agent configuration process defined by the SIP Forum.

section.title: Introduction
section.t:
The SIP Forum User Agent Configuration Recommendation defines a procedure for SIP User Agents to
determine the SIP domain from which to request configuration,
locate one or more server(s) that provide the configuration service for that domain,
construct a URL for and request configuration from that service,
request that the service send notices of any changes to that configuration.
The second step, locating the configuration service for a given domain, is achieved by the U-NAPTR (URI-Enabled NAPTR) application defined in , which builds upon the S-NAPTR (Simple NAPTR) application defined in .
This document registers the application service tag "SFUACFG" for this operation, as required by the U-NAPTR application.

front.title: Domain-Based Application Service Location Using SRV RRs and the Dynamic Delegation Discovery Service (DDDS)

abstract.t: This memo defines a generalized mechanism for application service naming that allows service location without relying on rigid domain naming conventions (so-called name hacks). The proposal defines a Dynamic Delegation Discovery System (DDDS) Application to map domain name, application service name, and application protocol dynamically to target server and port. [STANDARDS TRACK]

front.title: Domain-Based Application Service Location Using URIs and the Dynamic Delegation Discovery Service (DDDS)

abstract.t: The purpose of this document is to define a new, straightforward Dynamic Delegation Discovery Service (DDDS) application to allow mapping of domain names to URIs for particular application services and protocols. Although defined as a new DDDS application, dubbed U-NAPTR, this is effectively an extension of the Straightforward NAPTR (S-NAPTR) DDDS Application. [STANDARDS TRACK]
